page.title: 02Gazetteer cont'd.
page.content: It is privately owned but in need of restoration. Behind it is an ancient earthwork which is a good example of a Motte and Bailey defence work. Tothill's church has been removed, but the cemetery and old rectory remain, the latter is now a family home. Gayton Top now has a pheasant farm. A most important new feature in the village of Withern is a new surgery built next to the school and partly equipped by funds raised by local people and children. There is special emphasis placed on the health and welfare of the local children.
